Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effects of the vaccine by stating that it contains ingredients that will cause infertility and that immunized men can make unvaccinated women sterile. The expert's verdict states that there is no vaccine in the world that can cause infertility.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up its assertion that the vaccine contains ingredients that cause infertility. The expert's verdict provides evidence from a company spokesman and information from authorized vaccines that contradicts this claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation funded the vaccine and that there is a global depopulation effort. The expert's verdict states that GSK has not produced its own Covid-19 vaccine and that the partnerships it has are for contributing its adjuvant technology.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that GSK has not produced its own Covid-19 vaccine and that the partnerships it has are for contributing its adjuvant technology.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the claim or the expert's verdict.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times in the provided information.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation mentioned in the claim or the expert's verdict.
Other biases: There are no other biases identified in the claim or the expert's verdict.
